item.title: Using HELOC for Debt Consolidation in 2025: When It Makes Sense vs When It's a Trap
item.description:
Using your home equity to consolidate high-interest debt sounds appealingâ€”trade 18%-24% credit card rates for 8%-10% HELOC rates and save thousands in interest. But debt consolidation through HELOCs creates serious risks that financial marketers downplay: you’re converting unsecured debt into secured debt backed by your home, making strategic mistakes potentially catastrophic rather than merely expensive.

The HELOC Debt Consolidation Appeal: Real Interest Savings

The math behind HELOC debt consolidation is undeniably compelling for borrowers carrying substantial high-interest debt. Variable HELOC rates between 8%-11% drastically undercut typical credit card APRs of 18%-24%, creating immediate monthly payment relief and long-term interest savings.
